intro: Oothrinax, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers that resemble those of true hibiscus species. The plants typically have palmately lobed leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oothrinax species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Americas. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral displays.
